column1: [Research] Review current components capabilities based on Data explorer mockups
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Review the Data explorer mock ups

Data Explorer:

[https://www.figma.com/design/BM7tYtMktADHADND2nDuZS/Data-Explorer]

 

Report Concierge:

[https://www.figma.com/design/PRAqy16aO39nQAMhTK3vFz/Report-Concierge]

 

From mock ups, review which parts can be implemented from components from SDW.

Confluence: [https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=DBTools&title=OCI+Reporting+-+Components+and+features+from+SDW]

 

*Acceptance criteria:*
 * Mockups were reviewed.
 * Usable Components were added to the Confluence.
 * Components which need enhancements were documented.
 * Parts of the mockup that are not possible with today components are documented.
 * A sneak peek into possible APIs was documented.
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Story Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}

24/May/24 12:27 PM;alvaro.cabrales@oracle.com;Progress:

 * Worked on Data Explorer Page 2 views

*To do:*
 * Finish Data explorer UI review
 * Start with Report UI review;;Users;
column386:
28/May/24 7:32 PM;alvaro.cabrales@oracle.com;Agreed to start working on the following sections:
 * Reports
 * Analysis
 * Query;;Users;

column1: SQL History: Add a limit to SQL History to avoid preformance hit when the table is too big
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
*Acceptance criteria:*
 * Add a limit of 5000 entries to SQL History table.
 * When the limit is reached, when logging a new query the older one must be removed
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Enhancement Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385:
05/Mar/24 12:27 PM;arturo.g.gomez@oracle.com;*Yesterday*

Updated services.xml with trigger to handle SQL History limit of 5000.

*Today*

Will test keep adding entries after limit is reached.;;Users;
column386:
05/Mar/24 4:43 PM;arturo.g.gomez@oracle.com;*Yesterday*

Tested Trigger approach, its impact on performance is big when the table is at full capacity so I opted to use a Procedure and a scheduled job. Sent to code review

*Today*

Will attend any code review comments that arise;;Users;

column388:

column1: Tolerance parameter for spatial expression should be limited to positive number
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3505
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1161823

1. Create CSL (this is public bucket)
https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/geoJson/o/

2. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
3. Add us-states.geojson to cart
4. Open settings slider
5. Add Expression
6. Go to Spatial Expressions and set it to

Expression Type : Area
Input Column  : GEOMETRY
Target Column : GEOMETRY_AREA
Advanced Options : Tolerance : -0.1

7. Close slider and execute ingest
8. Previewing loaded table shows GEOMETRY_AREA values are all -1
9. Click Report button on Data Load homepage for the job just executed.
   Following error is reported.
{noformat}
ORA-13011: value is out of range
ORA-06512: at "MDSYS.SDO_GEOM", line 156
ORA-06512: at "MDSYS.MD", line 1723
ORA-06512: at "MDSYS.MDERR", line 8
ORA-06512: at "MDSYS.SDO_GEOM", line 119
ORA-06512: at "MDSYS.SDO_GEOM", line 152
ORA-06512: at "MDSYS.SDO_GEOM", line 2540
ORA-06512: at line 1
ORA-06512: at "C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST_ACTIONS", line 590
ORA-06512: at "C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST_ACTIONS", line 663
{noformat}
column48:
Fixed in master for the 24.2.0 release.

column1: Preview geojson with spatial expression causes ORA-00904: "GEOMETRY": invalid identifier
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3505
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1161823

1. Create CSL (this is public bucket)
https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/geoJson/o/

2. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
3. Add us-states.geojson to cart
4. Open settings slider
5. Add Expression
6. Go to Spatial Expressions and set it to

Expression Type : Area
Input Column  : GEOMETRY
Target Column : GEOMETRY_AREA

7. Go to Preview tab
8. Error shows up on the slider

Preview Data could not be returned for Object: us-states.geojson. 
ORA-00904: "GEOMETRY": invalid identifier

9. storage_object_preview api call fails
{noformat}
Request:

https://phoenix94094.dev3sub2phx.databasede3phx.oraclevcn.com:8443/ords/adptest/_adpdi/_services/objects/storage_object_preview/ 400 (Bad Request)

Payload:

{
  "owner": "ADPTEST",
  "cloud_storage_name": "GEOJSONBUCKET",
  "object_name": "us-states.geojson",
  "raw_size": 32000,
  "format_options_json": "{\"previewCSVFormat\":false,\"metadataSource\":[{\"fieldName\":\"geometry\",\"columnName\":\"geometry\",\"dataType\":\"SDO_GEOMETRY\",\"sourcePath\":\"$.geometry\",\"skipColumn\":false,\"piiFound\":false,\"columnId\":1},{\"fieldName\":\"name\",\"columnName\":\"name\",\"dataType\":\"VARCHAR2\",\"dataLength\":32767,\"dataFormat\":null,\"sourcePath\":\"$.properties.name\",\"skipColumn\":false,\"piiFound\":false,\"columnId\":2},{\"fieldName\":\"Area for GEOMETRY\",\"columnName\":\"Area for GEOMETRY\",\"dataType\":\"NUMBER\",\"skipColumn\":false,\"columnExpressionType\":\"SDO_AREA\",\"sourceColumn\":\"GEOMETRY\",\"piiFound\":false,\"columnId\":3}],\"formatString\":{\"conversionerrors\":\"store_null\"},\"adpBucket\":\"GEOJSONBUCKET\",\"headerStartRow\":1,\"metadataSourceType\":\"INLINE\",\"noCollectionSource\":true}",
  "get_raw_binary_data": "FALSE"
}

Response:

{"sqlcode":-904,
"sqlerrm":
"ORA-00904: \"GEOMETRY\": invalid identifier",
"backtrace":"ORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST\", line 24647\n
ORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST\", line 24611\n
ORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST\", line 24806\n
ORA-06512: at line 23\n",
"callstack":
"----- PL/SQL Call Stack -----\n
  object      line  object\n
  handle    number  name\n
0x78d397e0        45  anonymous block\n"}
{noformat}
column48:
Fix is merged into master for the 24.2.0 release.

column385: 06/May/24 10:26 AM;david.bardwell@oracle.com;This is a duplicate of bug 36557851. Please take a look. The bug includes a curl script that reproduces the issue.;;Users;
column386:
08/May/24 6:15 AM;ruqing.tang@oracle.com;David, there are several things missed in the format_options.

First sourceColumn name should be the same as the real source columnName. In this case, it should be 'geometry' instead 'GEOMETRY'.

 

Also, I think you already fixed other problem: 

GeoJSONONLY : true

GeoJSONRootPath either not set in order to use the default value, or set as the default value(copied from manifest): $.features

 

Any issue, please let me know.;;Users;

column1: Tolerance field on settings panel for GeoJSON accepts invalid value
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
1. Create CSL (this is public bucket)
https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/geoJson/o/

2. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
3. Add us-states.geojson to cart
4. Open settings slider
5. Tolerance field accepts invalid value like ABC.
   See attached screenshot.

column1: Add Ability to Load Iceberg From UI
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35: As described in ADBS-63770 the Data Load Load from Cloud Store navigator UI should look for folders with certain characteristics (a folder that contains both a metadata subfolder and a data subfolder, and a *metadata.json file inside the metadata subfolder).  When these folders are encountered, rather than expanding this folder, it should depict a different icon (table?).  When a user adds this to the cart, the UI should call analyze on the underlying metadata.json file and label it as of type iceberg.

column1: Mapping table gives warning for target column names in UTF-8 without double-quotes
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 23.4.3.0.18
ORDS : 23.4.0.r3361940 (rc2)

1. Go to Data Load > Local File
2. Add emp_utf8.csv to cart
3. Open slider
4. Note target column names in emp_utf8.csv are in UTF-8,
   and we don't have double-quotes around them.
5. Click on a target column name to get into edit mode,
   then click again in neutral space
6. Mapping error Warning shows up

Column names with spaces and special characters or reserved words must be
double quoted. Consider a column name without spaces and special characters
or double quote the name.

7. Click Close button shows error message on slider and confirmation dialog shows up
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385: 05/Dec/23 1:02 PM;goro.nambu@oracle.com;The problem seems not really new. In ORDS 23.3.0.r2891830, we double-quote the target column name by default. But we removed the double-quotes in ORDS 23.4.0.;;Users;

column1: Mapping grid shows wrong info after sorting
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3562
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1411955

1. Go to Load Data > Local File
2. Add emp.csv to cart
3. Open settings slider
4. Move mouse over to the right side of "Source" header column on
   the mapping grid.
5. When triangle icon shows up for sorting, click it.
6. When the sort is done, you see Length/Precision values become
   blank or NaN. Data Type for the last 2 columns stay read only.
column48:
This is now fixed and available for testing for the ords 24.2.0 release.

column1: Detail Error log grid shows a box inside each cell
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3597
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1512358

1. Create QABUCKET cloud storage link

sqlplus adptest/Oracle123456@cdb1_pdb7
@/home/gnambu/adptest/ingest/create_qabucket.sql

2. Go to Data Load > Cloud Store
3. Add Salaries_SF/ folder to cart and execute ingest
4. It finishes with 4 rejected rows
5. Click Report button on DL homepage
6. Go to Job Report tab and expand Detail Error Log grid
7. It shows a box inside each cell and probably due to that
   bottom of the texts are cut off.
8. Also horizontal scrollbar is not displayed

column1: Loading animation is rendered over slider's footer when selecting a file in folder for preview
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3376
ORDS : 24.1.0.b611124

1. Create QABUCKET cloud storage link

sqlplus adptest/Oracle123456@cdb1_pdb7
@/home/gnambu/adptest/ingest/create_qabucket.sql

2. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
3. Add EMP/ folder to cart
4. Open settings slider
5. Go to Preview tab and click Load Preview button
6. Select 2nd file in the object filter dropdown
7. You see loading animation for a moment,
   but the area goes over the slider's footer area.
   See attached screenshot.

column1: Remove reference to dbms-live-feed-start-end
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35: ADP shipped the dbms-live-feed-start-end tag with schema 24.2.1.  Since we have discovered since then that we need additional functionality, we need to make sure we don't ship ORDS which references that tag.  24.2.3 will ship with the dbms-live-feed-columns tag, but we don't know yet if that is sufficient.

column1: Only part of TIMESTAMP values are displayed in table preview
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3597
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1512358

1. Go to Load Data > Local File
2. Add emp.csv to cart
3. Open settings slider
4. Check Include check box for
   EMPNO, ENAME, HIREDATE, SYSTIMESTAMP
   and uncheck the rest.
   This is to check table preview in different data types
5. Execute ingest
6. Click table name on DL home page
7. Go to Preview tab
8. The last column which contains SYSTIMESTAMP shows only year-month-
   and the rest are not displayed. See attached screenshot.
9. Right mouse click on the column header (UPDATED_TIMESTAMP) and
   pick 'Resize to Fit' menu
10. The timestamp values are displayed properly

column35:

column1: Live Feed File Preview will not clear upon error
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
In Live Feed, when you list files to look for in the Object Filter, a potential list will be displayed in the 'Live Feed File Preview' and data is shown in 'File Preview'. (fndcalday1.csv)

If the user then changes the string in the Object Filter to a value that causes no files to be found, the 'File Preview' box will go away as expected. However the 'Live Feed File Preview' will remain showing all of the file(s) found at the last successful query.

To reproduce:

{starting from Data Studio Overview}
 # Click Create Live Feed Table, click Connections
 # Click and Create - New Cloud Store Location \{use location shown below}
 # Click Live Feed on side panel
 # Click Create Live Table Feed
 # Select Cloud Store Location created in step #2
 # for Object Filter, enter fndcalday1.csv
 ## after a moment, you will see Mixed/fndcalday1.csv & CSV/fndcalday1.csv as well as data in the File Preview window
 # replace fndcalday1.csv with plugh.csv in the Object Filter field and hit Enter

You will get a warning that there are currently no files to preview, the File Preview box will go away, but you will still see the same 2 files listed as being matched by the Object Filter.

 

URL for cloud location : [https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/ADP_LIVE_FEED/o]

 

Schema : 25.6.998.0.5
ORDS : 24.1.0.b732243

column1: IGNORE SPACE IN 'CREATE CLOUD LOCATION NAME' ELSE CAN CREATE MULTI CLOUD LOCATIONS WITH SAME NAME
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Schema 25.5.999.0.3297
ORDS 24.1.0.b251927

-go to Data Load-> Connections

-Create 4 Cloud Locations using Names for each as follows.
Public URL if needed
  https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/qa_public/o/

1. name:  testname
All lower case with no spaces at end

2. name:  testname 
All lower case with 1 space at end

3. name: TESTNAME 
All UPPER case with 1 space at end

4. name: testname
ALL lower case with 2 spaces at end

The 'Card' names in the UI Connections page for above:
1. TESTNAME
2. testname
3. TESTNAME
4. testname

column1: CREATING A CSL FROM A BUCKET WITH A NUMBER CAUSES A INVALID LINEAGE IDENTIFIER
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
1. Create a Bucket 123_CSL
2. Setup OCI Credentials in your instance to connect to OCI
3. Select 123_BUCKET
4. You get an Invalid Lineage Identifier as we try to create a CSL with the name of 123_CSL.

This error also occurs in Create Cloud Storage Link UI
We need to put a double quote around the identifier and then we can create the CSL
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385: 08/Mar/24 2:48 PM;sandeep.desai@oracle.com;Another related bug in this area is that if you already have CSL named for the bucket say A123_CSL and you click on the bucket, you can list the files in the navigator but when you add the file to the cart you get a Cloud Storage Link not found. The problem is that we pass 123_CSL for the bucket instead of A123_CSL;;Users;

column1: ADD FILE FROM BUCKET TO CART FAILS IF THE BUCKET IS USED BY AN EXISTING CSL WITH DIFFERENT NAME
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 24.5.999.0.3239
ORDS : 24.1.0.b3561533

1. You need to set Data Studio Preferences
   first, create OCI credential
2. Set cloud_identity to your compartment. For example:

-- ADP-QA compartment
alter database cloud_identity='{"TENANT_OCID":"ocid1.tenancy.oc1..aaaaaaaanh7sz33fsotvggjy7vay5mdcufxv5yhlvvlju7wclojr5gwqxq7q", "COMPARTMENT_OCID": "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaakpckwnox2enllczplvazpgabadgrof2l3mhr3fzkfm63yhz7rrha","REGION" : "us-phoenix-1"}';

3. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
4. Click gear button to bring up Data Studio Preferences
5. Set OCI Credential and Compartment
6. Cloud Location dropdown should show 'Buckets' section
7. Select one of the buckets in the location list.
   In my case, I picked DATALOADREGRESS in ADP-QA compartment
8. This will create CSL called DATALOADREGRESS
9. Rename the CSL to DATALOADREGRESS_RENAMED
   You can do it from location bar menu or Connections page
10. Go back to Load from Cloud page
11. Select the same bucket from the location list
    In my case, select DATALOADREGRESS again
12. Select a csv file and add it to cart
13. Error pops up

ORA-20749: Cloud storage "ADPTEST"."DATALOADREGRESS" does not exist.

column1: Add Cloud Store Location UI should improve policy errors
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35: When the native OCI credential is not able to list buckets (whether because the credential is for a different compartment than is chosen, or is missing a policy), we should not just show the URL getting a 404.  This error should be trapped and replaced by a message about credential not allowed to list buckets for the chosen compartment.

column1: DCAT: RELOAD DATA LOAD JOB FOR DATA CATALOG LINK OPENS WRONG PAGE AND FAILS TO RELOAD THE JOB
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 24.1.1.0.12
ORDS : 23.4.0.r3461619

1. Start DL app and go to Cloud Locations
2. Click on Register Data Catalog
3. Register 'Adpm Test Catalog'

Name:
DCATQA1

Select Credential:
You can use ADPMDC_CRED defined in this file in our test env
$T_WORK/adp/no_ship/test/ingest/sql/adp_dcat_prep.sql

Region:
"region":"us-phoenix-1"

Data Catalog ID:
"catalogOCID":"ocid1.datacatalog.oc1.phx.amaaaaaa7ratcziaddwegiqgdnzvp4hu6cuer4sjbel6osyfe3yqvkbtx2ja"

Use separate credential for Object Storage
Select Credential:
ADPDEMO_CRED

4. Click Next button, then Create
5. Go to Link Data > OCI Data Catalog
6. Select "DCATQA1 (adpqa_object_storage) (DataLoadRegress)" for source catalog
7. Add PART logical entity to cart
8. Execute ingest
9. Click Done when ingest job is finished
10. Go to Data Load Jobs page
11. Find the job just executed, and pick 'Reload Data Load Job' menu
12. It opens Link Data / Cloud Store page, showing following line
    in the location bar.

ADPDCAT$.DCATQA1.adpqa_object_storage.DataLoadRegress
.

column1: Add support for loading from zip files
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35: As specified in the spec, zip files will need some special handling to be fully supported.  When a user adds a zip file to the cart, an array of manifests will be returned (or for each supported file type).  Each of these will need to create its own cart tile.  (Additional manifest clauses will need to be transmitted as well.)  This is similar to how XLSX files are currently done.

column1: Close button is out of reach on View Objects slider for a cloud storage link
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 24.2.3.0.20
ORDS : 24.1.1.r1201228

1. Create QABUCKET cloud storage link

sqlplus adptest/Oracle123456@cdb1_pdb7
@/home/gnambu/adptest/ingest/create_qabucket.sql

2. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
3. Add emp.csv folder to cart
4. Open slider and set target table name to something distinguishable
5. Execute ingest
6. When ingest is done, find the job just executed
   and click link to QABUCKET in the job description
7. View Objects slider comes up
8. Close button is out of reach. See attached screenshot.
   It might be related to the bucket having objects with long file name?
   I don't see this problem in other bucket.

column1: Add .tif as valid file name extension for image file
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3553
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1361407

For loading image files, we added .tiff as valid file name extension.
It seems like .tif is also fairly common.

 

Reassigning to AA.  This is a server side setting.
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385: 29/May/24 10:25 AM;adam.kociubes@oracle.com;The list of supported extensions is hardcoded in ORDS.  We could either add .tif to it, or even better, would be to get the list from the backend (get_adp_status has this info.);;Users;
column386:
03/Jun/24 11:22 AM;david.dedonato@oracle.com;According to Ken, we do call the backend to get this list.  There is a rest call to give us back the list.

Yes we get the the list of valid file suffixes from the backend via a REST call.  See adpSchemaStatus.js function getAllowedFileExtensions and other functions there.However, we override this extension list for local file load where we are not using cloud stage load.See line 1940 of ingest.js.  So there is work we also need to do on the client side;;Users;

column1: The height of Create Credential dialog shrinks in show code mode
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3597
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1512358
 # Go to Data Load > Connections
2. Open Data Studio Preferences
3. Click Create Credential
4. Create Credential dialog comes up
5. Switch to Show code mode
6. The height of the dialog shrinks
   The code area is too small to show the code block

Redwood Issue

column1: Try out accessing the AirportDB benchmark
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Try out accessing the AirportDB benchmark following the steps on the [confluence|https://confluence.oci.oraclecorp.com/display/MYSQL/Airportdb+with+SQL+worksheet+and+MySQL+shell] the MySQL Heatwave team have provided.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Check if it was possible to access the AirportDB benchmark.
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Story Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385:
02/Apr/24 1:21 PM;gustavo.flores.cortes@oracle.com;*Yesterday:*
 * Check for the wiki in order to follow the queries to load sample data from an airportdb.
 * The buckets provided where no longer available. Ask for an update URL for testing.

*Today:*
 * Finish testing the queries for load data from airportdb, checking time and behavior of SQL Worksheet.

*Blockers:*
 * None;;Users;
column386:
03/Apr/24 11:51 AM;gustavo.flores.cortes@oracle.com;*Status:*
 * After doing the testing the queries to load the datasets run correctly, however there was some format issues according to the script output but when doing a select query to the tables there was not any problem. With this progress we can conclude that is it possible to load the datasets from an airportdb on an external object storage using queries on the worksheet using HeatWave/Lakehouse.
 ** !image-2024-04-03-09-46-44-651.png|width=540,height=239!
 * One thing to take note is the use of the `SET AUTOCOMMIT=ON;` in order to do queries over the tables with `SECONDARY_LOAD`, if not then an error will be shown as a result
 ** !image-2024-04-03-09-49-47-216.png|width=390,height=286!
 ** !image-2024-04-03-09-51-01-079.png|width=387,height=269!;;Users;

column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
 * A slider should be open when View Details option on the sample dataset list is selected.
 * The slider should show basic information about the dataset sample obtained from the manifest ( name of dataset, TBD ).

column1: Create service to get the list of datasets from manifest
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Create service to get the list of datasets from manifest the HeatWave team provide.

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+
 * The service should be able to use params in order to create the URL.
 * The service should return the list of datasets available on the manifest HeatWave team provide.
 * Get samples from datasets and show it on the UI ( navigation list ).
 * Handle when an item is not found ( add UI if necessary ).

column1: Create navigator for datasets objects
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Create navigator for datasets objects in order to see the loaded datasets on the DB, according to the design proposal
!image-2024-05-08-10-58-45-867.png!

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * An object should be visible on the UI when the dataset is loaded.
 * A progress of loading should be visible on the UI during the loading process.
 * The UI should be according to the Figma propospal.

column1: Use UI list to load data into the DB
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Use UI list to load data into the DB System using the sample dataset queries statements.

*+Acceptance Criteria+*
 * When the load dataset button is clicked from the samples list menu it should load the queries statements into the worksheet.
 * When the load dataset button is clicked from the details slider it should load the queries statements into the worksheet.
 * The queries statements should infer the region.
 * The queries should use the Lakehouse commands.

column1: Check for partial success on SQL History DELETE endpoint
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
*Backend*
 * Instead of using DELETE WHERE ID IN, use a for and delete each ID individually. If theres a partial success, return error status 207
 * Instead of throwing the exception directly when any ID fails to be deleted, add the IDs with error in a variable and if the variable is populated at the end, return status 207 and on the error-reason header return the ids that were unable to be deleted.

*Frontend*
 * When a response is returned for status 207, display the error message when an entry cannot be deleted.
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Enhancement Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385: 27/Feb/24 9:57 AM;antonio.campos@oracle.com;Minor adjustment in the acceptance criteria, the 207 status should return the status of all items, not only the ones that failed.;;Users;
column386:
06/Mar/24 12:40 PM;jose.madrigal@oracle.com;Performing tests to verify that if any of them items fails, it sends a status code 207, and if not, 204.

*Today*

In the final round of testing to detect possible minor bugs, and it will be sent for code review.;;Users;

column1: Disable tours and help links in Launchpad for OCI mode only
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
The Launchpad in the OCI Plugin is showing walkthrough buttons and help links, but in the OCI plugin for example the SQL Worksheet tour is disabled, also there is no help panel so the help links also need to be "hidden" in the Launchpad only when OCI mode is detected.

+*Acceptance Criteria*+
 * There should not be Walkthrough buttons in OCI Launchpad
 * There should not be Help Links that open the Help Panel in OCI Launchpad
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Story Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385:
16/May/24 11:24 AM;julio.tinajero@oracle.com;*Update*
- Added conditions on Launchpad code to disable walkthrough links
- Did some research about which tour technology is being used in OCI, found that the library being used is driver.js, and the OCI tour is located on this repo: https://bitbucket.oci.oraclecorp.com/projects/UX/repos/oci-console-guided-journey/browse/package.json

- Working on disabling tours on Modeler and Scheduling pages for OCI only

*No blockers*;;Users;
column386:
16/May/24 10:09 PM;julio.tinajero@oracle.com;*Update*
- After disabling tour buttons on Modeler noticed there were also help buttons still active on the Object Navigator within SQL Worksheet. Disabled all remaining help buttons.
- When disabling tours on Modeler and Scheduling pages noticed that there are many help buttons on different sliders that also need to be hidden within Scheduling pages.

*What's next*
-Find the rest of sliders that have help button and hide the buttons using config.cloudService 

*No blockers*;;Users;
column387: 20/May/24 9:36 PM;ese-generic-jira-user_ww@oracle.com;[julio_tinajero|https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/julio_tinajero] mentioned this issue in [a merge request|https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/rest-data-services/-/merge_requests/13098] of [database-dbtools-dev / rest-data-services|https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/rest-data-services] on branch [ORDS_14693|https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/rest-data-services/-/tree/ORDS_14693]:{quote}Disable tours and help links in Launchpad for OCI mode only{quote};;;

column1: FOR INSERT INTO TABLE WITH NO COLUMN HEADER DATE FORMAT IS NOT SHOWN IN SQL
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Steps
Load emp.csv into EMP table
Add emp.csv to cart
Change Option to Insert Into table
Select EMP table
Unselect Column Header Row
All the mapping columns should turn into COLUMN_1, COLUMN_2, ...
Map the first column to HIREDATE and change the date format 
Note that you dont see the Data format Mask in the field list




DECLARE
  l_TABLE_NAME        DBMS_QUOTED_ID := '"EMP"';
  l_CREDENTIAL_NAME   DBMS_QUOTED_ID := '"SANDEEP_OCLOUD_CRED"';
  l_FILE_URI_LIST     CLOB :=
    q'['https://objectstorage.us-ashburn-1.oraclecloud.com/n/iduy06y69xfh/b/bucket-sandeep/o/emp.csv']';
  l_FIELD_LIST        CLOB :=
    q'[
     "HIREDATE"  CHAR
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR(32767)
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR(32767)
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR date_format DATE MASK "DD-MON-RR"
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR
    ,"<Select>"  CHAR]';
  l_FORMAT            CLOB :=
    '{
       "delimiter" : ",",
       "ignoremissingcolumns" : true,
       "ignoreblanklines" : true,
       "blankasnull" : true,
       "trimspaces" : "lrtrim",
       "quote" : "\"",
       "characterset" : "US7ASCII",
       "skipheaders" : 0,
       "logprefix" : "EMP",
       "logretention" : 7,
       "rejectlimit" : 10000000,
       "recorddelimiter" : "X''0D0A''"
     }';
  l_SCHEMA_NAME       DBMS_QUOTED_ID := '"ADPTEST"';
  l_OPERATION_ID      NUMBER ; /* OUT */
BEGIN
  "C##CLOUD$SERVICE"."DBMS_CLOUD"."COPY_DATA"
  ( TABLE_NAME        => l_TABLE_NAME
   ,CREDENTIAL_NAME   => l_CREDENTIAL_NAME
   ,FILE_URI_LIST     => l_FILE_URI_LIST
   ,FIELD_LIST        => l_FIELD_LIST
   ,FORMAT            => l_FORMAT
   ,SCHEMA_NAME       => l_SCHEMA_NAME
   ,OPERATION_ID      => l_OPERATION_ID
  );
END;
/
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385:
13/Mar/24 11:43 AM;kenneth.chin@oracle.com;Behavior has changed.

Steps
0. Using QABucket
1. add emp.csv to Data Load > Load Data Cloud Store cart
2. open settings panel on the cart item.
3. Change Option to insert table and pick a previously loaded table with the same file as data.  (i.e. EMP).
4. Uncheck the Column header row checkbox
5. Check include on first column, COLUMN_1 and map it to HIREDATE and change the date format to DD-MON-RR
6. Select the SQL tab for preview of SQL
7. Note error displays in SQL tab:  ORA-20292: Missing data format mask for column "HIREDATE" with data type DATE.

 !image-2024-03-13-11-48-30-118.png|thumbnail! 

These settings pass the following arguments to the ADPSCHEMA package call

 result := DBMS_INGEST.INGEST_MANIFEST(:credential_name, :ingest_manifest_json);

credential_name := null

ingest_manifest_json := 

{
    "adpBucket": "QABUCKET",
    "overwriteOption": "SKIP",
    "tableName": "ADPDI_CLOUD_EMP",
    "loadMethod": "APPEND",
    "headerStartRow": 0,
    "formatString": {
        "delimiter": ",",
        "recorddelimiter": "\r\n",
        "ignoremissingcolumns": true,
        "ignoreblanklines": true,
        "blankasnull": true,
        "rejectlimit": 10000,
        "trimspaces": "lrtrim",
        "quote": "\"",
        "characterset": "AL32UTF8",
        "skipheaders": 0,
        "logprefix": "ADPDI_CLOUD_EMP"
    },
    "objectNames": [
        {
            "objectName": "emp.csv"
        }
    ],
    "jobClass": "HIGH",
    "useSimpleColumnNames": true,
    "objectDesc": {
        "metadataSourceType": "INLINE",
        "metadataSourceOwner": null,
        "metadataSource": [
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_1",
                "columnName": "HIREDATE",
                "dataType": "DATE",
                "skipColumn": false,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 1
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_2",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_2",
                "dataType": "VARCHAR2",
                "dataLength": 32767,
                "dataFormat": null,
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 2
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_3",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_3",
                "dataType": "VARCHAR2",
                "dataLength": 32767,
                "dataFormat": null,
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 3
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_4",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_4",
                "dataType": "NUMBER",
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 4
            },
            {
                "dataFormat": "DD-MON-RR",
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_5",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_5",
                "dataType": "DATE",
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 5
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_6",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_6",
                "dataType": "NUMBER",
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 6
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_7",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_7",
                "dataType": "NUMBER",
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 7
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "COLUMN_8",
                "columnName": "COLUMN_8",
                "dataType": "NUMBER",
                "skipColumn": true,
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 8
            },
            {
                "fieldName": "FILE$NAME",
                "columnName": "FILENAME",
                "dataType": "VARCHAR2",
                "dataLength": 64,
                "dataFormat": null,
                "skipColumn": false,
                "virtualColumn": false,
                "columnExpression": "FILE$NAME",
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 9
            },
            {
                "dataFormat": "YYYY-MM-DD\"T\"HH24:MI:SS.FFTZH:TZM",
                "fieldName": "SYSTIMESTAMP",
                "columnName": "UPDATED_TIMESTAMP",
                "dataType": "TIMESTAMP(6) WITH TIME ZONE",
                "skipColumn": false,
                "virtualColumn": false,
                "columnExpression": "SYSTIMESTAMP",
                "piiFound": false,
                "columnId": 10
            }
        ]
    },
    "generateOnly": true,
    "runAsBackgroundJob": "N",
    "noCollectionSource": true,
    "checkPII": true
}

column1: Upgrade to JET 14 -  Redwood - Data Loader - No footer buttons shown in the Settings Wizard within the slider & style corrections
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
*Data Loader*
 * Add file button appears with no spacing between dividers
 * No footer buttons are shown in the Settings Wizard within the slider, not correctly aligned within content (file details and target details)

!https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/download/attachments/9481262449/image-2024-3-25_12-29-47.png?version=1&modificationDate=1711391387457&api=v2|height=250!!https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/download/attachments/9481262449/image-2024-3-25_12-31-20.png?version=1&modificationDate=1711391481230&api=v2|height=250!

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Add spacing or correct to have enough spacing and keep centered vertically for slider content wizard for file-details and target-details
 * Buttons should be displayed in the Data Loader bottom footer Wizard

column1: Translate expression does not work for append
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3541
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1341447

1. Go to Load Data > Local File
2. Add emp.csv to cart
3. Open settings slider
4. Click Add Expression button
5. Set parameters

Expression Type: Text Translation
Input Column: JOB
Target Language: Spanish

6. Close slider and execute ingest
7. When ingest is finished, check table preview and make sure
   the JOB_TRANSLATION column has proper values.
8. Add emp.csv to cart again
9. Set option to Insert into Table, and set target table to
   the one just created.
10. Click pencil button on 'Text Translation for JOB' column
11. Target Language is now English (Should this be Spanish?)
12. OK button is grayed out and not able to click
13. Close slider and execute ingest
14. Check table preview
15. In JOB_TRANSLATION column, appended values are all DS$UNPOPULATED
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385: 15/May/24 4:51 PM;david.dedonato@oracle.com;Not sure if this might be a backend bug.;;Users;
column387:
15/May/24 6:18 PM;david.bardwell@oracle.com;There is a missing translation target language on insert into table case. This initially appeared as a front-end bug but further analysis below suggests it is a backend issue afterall.
;;Users;
column389:
16/May/24 10:55 AM;zhiqi.qiu@oracle.com;Translation action was called for in the append job, but it returned an error:

{"sqlcode":-20934,"sqlerrm":"ORA-20934: Unspecified language code.","errorStack"
:"ORA-20934: Unspecified language code.\nORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_LIN
EAGE_ERROR\", line 3955\nORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_DATA_TOOLS_LANG\",
line 101\nORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_DATA_TOOLS_LANG\", line 218\nORA-0
6512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST_ACTIONS\",

Looks like the Post Action json generation code did not include target language specification. ;;Users;
column390: 16/May/24 10:56 AM;zhiqi.qiu@oracle.com;Could you look at this issue? Target language info should be retrieved during append, right? ;;Users;

column1: Download, Set environment and build SQL Developer Next
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Clone SQL Developer REST into local machine using git
 * Configure repository following the instructions on the repo: [https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/sql-developer-next]
 * Perform a build and run SQL Developer Next locally
 * Make a change to ensure the current code is being run
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Story Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385:
06/May/24 8:21 PM;arturo.g.gomez@oracle.com;*Yesterday*

Cloned SQL Developer Next repo, ran environment set up script, encountered issues. First it was related to permissions on specific folders, that issue is fixed. However, I'm running into another npm error running the script. Checked with Leo, we're using the same node version. This may be related to the M1 processor. Still looking for a solution

*Today*

Will work on fixing the blocker with the environment setup. 

*Blockers*

Unable to set environment;;Users;
column387:
10/May/24 2:42 PM;arturo.g.gomez@oracle.com;*Yesterday*

I was finally able to run the setup script for the repository. I uninstalled everything yarn,node, etc and then reinstalled again and modified the no-proxy variable on .nprc and was finally able to install yarn from the CLI. Started Working on build, but it failed

*Today*

Will be working on making the SDN build work to be able to play with the project and have an idea of what will need to be done for the simplified REST Workshop;;Users;
column388:
14/May/24 9:44 PM;arturo.g.gomez@oracle.com;*Yesterday*

Spent the whole day debugging, trying to generate dist folder to test the application. Still have been unable to succesfully generate it. 
The build is already passing, but the extensions artifacts are not generated. 


Here's what I tried:
 * Old npm version (5.1.0) persists in npx despite numerous attempts to remove it.
 * Uninstalled/reinstalled npx, cleared caches, checked environment variables.
 * Suspect issue lies deep within npx configuration/dependencies.
 * Attempting complete removal of npx and Node.js through nvm, then fresh reinstall.

After troubleshooting. Apparently part of the issue is Artifactory's latest version of npx is very old and it bundles with npm 5.1 which is pretty old.

After this. I changed the registry to use npm's official registry but now I'm getting another error.

*Today*

Will check new error. If problems persist, I'll have a meeting with Leo if possible to troubleshoot. If it still persists I'll escalate the issue

 ;;Users;

column1: User cannot select column name when removing expression column
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3541
ORDS : 24.2.0.b1341447

1. Go to Load Data > Local File
2. Add emp.csv to cart
3. Open settings slider
4. Add 2 expression columns

- Expression 1
Expression Type: Language Detection
Input Column: JOB

- Expression 2
Expression Type: Text Translation
Input Column: JOB
Target Language: Spanish

5. Uncheck and check back Include checkbox for one of the 2 expression
   columns to enable Remove Expression button (Jira issue ORDS-14679)
6. User can click Remove Expression button but there is no way to
   select which column to remove.

column1: Reload data load job fails for OCI data catalog data load job
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 24.5.999.0.3149
ORDS : 23.4.0.b3112230

1. Create credential. You need to edit connect string in this script.
   (or you can set TWO_TASK environment variable)

$T_WORK/adp/no_ship/test/ingest/sql/adp_dcat_prep.sql

2. Go to Connections page
3. Register Data Catalog with following info

Catalog Name:
DCATQA1

Credential for DCAT Connection:
ADPMDC_CRED

Region:
us-phoenix-1

Data Catalog ID:
ocid1.datacatalog.oc1.phx.amaaaaaa7ratcziaddwegiqgdnzvp4hu6cuer4sjbel6osyfe3yqvkbtx2ja

Check 'Use separate credential for Object Storage' checkbox

Credential for Object Storage:
ADPDEMO_CRED

4. Go to Link Data page and click OCI Data Catalog
5. Select DCATQA1 (adpqa_object_storage) (DataLoadRegress) in the location dropdown
6. Add PART object to cart
7. Change target name to DCAT_PART_XT and execute ingest
8. Click Done when job is finished
9. Go to Data Load Jobs page
10. Find the job just executed and select 'Reload Data Load Job' from menu
11. Reload the job fails. It opens Link Data / Cloud Store page.
12. Also location bar shows unexpected string
    ADPDCAT$.DCATQA1.adpqa_object_storage.DataLoadRegress

column1: REFRESH BUTTON ON THE LOCATION BAR SWITCHES CSL TO THE FIRST ONE IN THE LIST
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 23.4.4.0.8
ORDS : 23.4.0.r3461619

1. Create an OCI credential and set cloud_identity for your pdb
   so you can set up Preference.
2. Go to DL app and open Preference slider
   Make sure you have OCI Credential and Compartment set properly.
3. You need multiple CSLs for this test. If you don't have
   you can create QABUCKET and SELENIUMREGRESSCRED

sqlplus adptest/Oracle123456@cdb1_pdb7
@/home/gnambu/adptest/ingest/create_qabucket.sql
@/home/gnambu/adptest/ingest/create_seleniumregressbucket.sql

4. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
5. In the location dropdown, you should see 'Buckets' section
   if you set your preference correctly.
6. From location dropdown select a CSL which is not the first one.
   For example, in my test environment QABUCKET is the fist,
   so select SELENIUMREGRESSCRED.
7. Make sure navigator tree is refreshed correctly
8. Click refresh button on the right edge of the location bar
9. The location bar switches to QABUCKET (first one in the list)
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}

column1: buckets api call fails as 400 bad request when you set OCI credential to the one that has no access to object store
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 24.5.999.0.3162
ORDS : 23.4.0.b3181712

1. Create credential ADPMDC_CRED. This credential is for Data Catalog access
   and doesn't have privilege to access object store.

   You can run this script in our test environment, but need to edit connect
   string in this script.

$T_WORK/adp/no_ship/test/ingest/sql/adp_dcat_prep.sql

2. Set default compartment to ADP-QA
{noformat}
sqlplus admin/AutoS_Y_S123#@cdb1_pdb7
alter database cloud_identity='{"TENANT_OCID":"ocid1.tenancy.oc1..aaaaaaaanh7sz33fsotvggjy7vay5mdcufxv5yhlvvlju7wclojr5gwqxq7q", "COMPARTMENT_OCID": "ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaakpckwnox2enllczplvazpgabadgrof2l3mhr3fzkfm63yhz7rrha","REGION" : "us-phoenix-1"}';
{noformat}
3. Go to Load Data > Cloud Store
4. Click gear button and set OCI credential preference to ADPMDC_CRED
5. Every time you go to Load Cloud Store page or refresh button on the location bar,
   buckets api call fails.

Request:
{noformat}
https://phoenix94094.dev3sub2phx.databasede3phx.oraclevcn.com:8443/ords/adptest/_adpdi/_services/objects/buckets/?credentialName=ADPMDC_CRED&_=1699991428315
400 (Bad Request)
{noformat}
Response:
{noformat}
{"sqlcode":-20404,
"sqlerrm":
"ORA-20404: Object not found - https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/?limit=1000&compartmentId=ocid1.compartment.oc1..aaaaaaaakpckwnox2enllczplvazpgabadgrof2l3mhr3fzkfm63yhz7rrha",
"backtrace":
"ORA-06512: at \"C##CLOUD$SERVICE.DBMS_CLOUD\", line 1679\n
ORA-06512: at \"C##CLOUD$SERVICE.DBMS_CLOUD\", line 9735\n
ORA-06512: at line 19\n
ORA-06512: at \"C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST_UTIL\", line 180\n
ORA-06512: at line 1\nORA-06512: at line 32\n
ORA-06512: at line 32\n",
"callstack":
"----- PL/SQL Call Stack -----\n
  object      line  object\n
  handle    number  name\n
0x8f300f80        64  anonymous block\n"}
{noformat}
column36:
The List Buckets can fail for any reason and only causes the buckets to not be show, we should probably show a warning icon like Preferences to indicate this status.
This is not a blocker
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}
column385: 10/Mar/24 8:04 PM;david.dedonato@oracle.com;We need to trap this error and return a better message back to the user.  Something like "The current user credential  does not have the proper privileges to access files from this object storage location";;Users;

column1: Partition validation message is not displayed
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
ADP  : 25.5.999.0.3350
ORDS : 24.1.0.b461910

1. Create SELENIUMREGRESSBUCKET cloud storage link

sqlplus adptest/Oracle123456@cdb1_pdb7
@/home/gnambu/adptest/ingest/create_seleniumregressbucket.sql

2. Go to Link Data > Cloud Store
3. Add PART/Invalid/ folder to cart
4. Open settings slider
5. Set Partition Column to HIREDATE
6. Execute ingest

In ORDS 23.4.0, you can open slider after the ingest and go to Table tab.
It showed partition validation message:

9 rows validated, 3 rows failed. Data in file partition does not match with folder or file name format.

This messasge is no longer available in 24.1.0

column1: Example URL in Add Cloud Store Location is incorrect
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
The current example URL in Add Cloud Store Location needs an additional /n/ before the name space portion. Below is the correct format.

https://objectstorage.,region>.oraclecloud.com/n/<namespace>/b/<bucket>/o
                                                                                      ^^^

Alternatively, could also suggest the new OCI URL format:
https://<namespace>.objectstorage.<region>.oci.customer-oci.com/n/<namespace> /b/<bucket> /o/<file>

column1: Remove the guard against zip files in Data Load UI
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Currently, when you attempt to analyze a zip file, the UI pops up a message:
"Cloud File
Load for a ZIP File is not supported."
 
Support has been added to the backend in 24.2.2 for ingesting zip files.  Please remove this guard from adding zip files (if the get_adp_status tag ZIP_ARCHIVES exists).  
 
Removing this guard will allow preliminary support for zip files (including single file archives).
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}

column1: Implement load from images in UI
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
The backend now supports loading charts embedded in images (jpeg, pdf, tiff, png).  The UI needs to be updated to transmit the new manifest option as specified in the spec.  

 

If performance is too slow, we might need to create new phases in the UI (pre-analyze vs analyze) so ords does not time out.  Starting with small png examples would allow some experimentation and demos.
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} This issue is of type Defect Hence all updates to this isssue will not be sync'ed to BugDatabase.{panel}

column1: Test  new --java-options command
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Hi Sathya.

The following new command line option should be tested.

A full test spec can be found here.
https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/display/DBTools/Test+Specifications+for+ORDS-10591

The requirement/funtional spec can be found here.
https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/display/DBTools/ORDS-10591+ADD+--JAVA-OPTIONS+PARAMETER+TO+SPECIFY+THE+CUSTOM+JAVA+OPTIONS+TO+APPLY+AT+RUNTIME

We can schedule a time to demo if you wish.

Customer's SR is https://mosemp.us.oracle.com/mosspui/src/sr/viewer/index.html#/3-36553321831

Customer is invoking ATP objects via ORDS rest service, for the same pattern of input payloads it gives 400 Bad Request intermittently.

column386:
03/May/24 6:28 PM;rene.mendez@oracle.com;Debugging the STRUCT class

 

When the issue is reproduced the exception is thrown from [https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/dbtools-commons/-/blob/master/common/src/main/java/oracle/dbtools/raptor/datatypes/oracle/sql/STRUCT.java#L205]

And is triggered by [https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/dbtools-commons/-/blob/master/common/src/main/java/oracle/dbtools/raptor/datatypes/oracle/sql/STRUCT.java#L200]

 

The exception before wrapped into the DataTypeIllegalArgumentException is 

 
java.sql.SQLRecoverableException: The connection is closed

 

 

With the DataTypeIllegalArgumentException parameters =>

 

this = PDBDBA.LINE

internalValue (LinkedList) = [300000752188741, 300000752188772, 1, 300000752188736, 1, TPLINKVX420G2V, TP Link VX420 G2V, Awaiting Shipping, 1, 1, null, 300000025534413, TTL, TPG Telecom Logistics - Primary Sellable Location, null, null, null, null, 2024-05-06 07:59:59, null, null, null, null, null, null, ORDER, null, 300000752188741, 1, Buy, null, 1, null, null, null, null, null, null, Each, null, 2024-05-06 18:00:00, null]

e=java.sql.SQLRecoverableException: The connection is closed

 ;;Users;
column388:
05/May/24 11:07 AM;dermot.oneill@oracle.com;ords metadata cache has an imapct on this issue.
It was found that disabling the caches resolve the issue.

As the customer is facing ongoing issue we can disable the cache in ADB-S Production while we identify and fix the root cause.

Update the global settings.xml
<entry key="cache.metadata.enabled">false</entry>

column1: EXTRA CONNECTION BORROWED FROM POOL FOR EVERY REQUEST - DATABASEURLMAPPINGBASE.ADDSERVICES
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Flight recording recording shows that DatabaseURLMappingBase.addServices ends up calling JDBCSchemaTarget.getConnection(final ConnectionSchemaType userType) indirectly twice.
SchemaOverride and PoolInjector may have to be refactored to use a connection instance that that is passed to it from DatabaseURLMappingBase.addServices.
column68: 07/May/24 11:48 AM;peter.j.obrien@oracle.com;refactored code shows only one call to UCP at DatabaseURLMappingBase addServices.png;https://jira.oraclecorp.com/jira/secure/attachment/3969547/refactored+code+shows+only+one+call+to+UCP+at+DatabaseURLMappingBase+addServices.png

column1: STABLE: IN THE ORDS LANDING PAGE, APEX IS SHOW AS UNAVAILABLE FOR FEW MINS.
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
1. In Stable, provision a new 19c Paid PDB.
2. Once the PDB is provisioned successfully, enter the URL in any browser,
something like :
https://ibuwlq4mjqkeils-namatp040719p.adb-stable.us-ashburn-1.oraclecloudapps.
com/ords/_/landing

Current Result:
You can observe that for APEX we see the icon is showing App Unavailable.

NOTE: This happens ONLY for a newly provisioned PDB. Also, after few mins
(4-5 mins), refresh the page, and the APEX app will become available.

Please see the screenshot attached.

column1: ORDS RPM INSTALL PROCESS CREATES A BROKEN SYMBOLIC LINK WHEN MYSQL-CONNECTOR IS NOT FOUND
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Currently the ORDS RPM searchs for 
/usr/share/java/mysql-connector-java.jar 

And if the files exist  create an symbolic link on /<ords_prefix>/lib/ext/

But if the files does not exist creates a broken (empty) symbolic link on /

lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 49 May 30 17:02 /mysql-connector-java.jar -> /opt/oracle/ords/lib/ext/mysql-connector-java.jar

column1: SDW HANGS TRYING TO LOAD NDJSON DATA SETS
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Steps to reproduce 
* Navigate to SQL.
* Click on the "Data Load" button.
* Drag and drop file movies.json. on the "Data Loading" slider.
* Labels "Loading" and "Processing file..." appear and never go away. The task gets stuck.

It should load the structure of the first level as flattened data. If their values are objects or arrays, then we should stringify them.





3:35
The loading is not flexible. It doesn't allow to load data with the JSON format that the same Worksheet or the REST APIs from ORDS generate.

column1: JDBCDATASOURCESPROVIDER FOR EXTERNAL APPLICATIONS, THE 3 SERVICES LOAD THE POOL EACH TIME
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
JDBCDataSourcesProvider for external applications, the 3 services load the pool each time.

This means to initialize the 3 services, 3 calls to Broker are made.

Each one can take ~ a second.

So for an external application like Mongo Listener to setup the 3 services provided by ORDS can initially take ~ 3 seconds.

This is noticeable in demos .

 

The ORDS API could be changed so that the pool is initialised once.

column392:
02/May/24 7:06 PM;carlos.quirarte@oracle.com;*Status*

1.- Bug confirmed.

2.- There's no workaround.

3.=The root cause is in the JDBC DataSoruce provider class, it calls 3 times a function called [Apply|https://orahub.oci.oraclecorp.com/database-dbtools-dev/rest-data-services/-/blob/master/product/ords-url-mapping/src/main/java/oracle/dbtools/url/mapping/db/JDBCDataSourcesProvider.java#L208 thats the function that loads the pool.

4.-The proposal fix is to use a fast expiring cache that makes the first load and the other 2 just access to the value from the cache a lot faster thn loading again the pool.

5.- Right now the proposal fix is on code review, they asked me to add JUnit Tests, I'm finding a way to do that, because it need a remote config server.

6.- MR mention confirmed.

7.- Working on steps to verify and test the solution.

8.- I received answers, and I have to work on a J Unit test, I asked what to say on the log.;;Users;
column395:
07/May/24 4:30 PM;carlos.quirarte@oracle.com;8.-  I modified an existing JUnit test to use caching, and in the workflow test the same expected behavior, and logs for new Datasource cache computing.  
This  has been pushed on the MR;;Users;

column385:
29/Apr/24 2:23 PM;rene.mendez@oracle.com;Two things are happening:

1. offset and limit cannot be extracted from the servlet's request parameters directly for the MLE. The result is that the req.limit and req.offset parameters are always empty.

2. The JDBC calls fails because of a pagination strategy set to none in the service's metadata. (If 1 is fixed, 2 still returns 400).


Proposal

1. Extract the pagination offset and limit from the request attributes.

2. Mutate the request after processing to change the pagination strategy before the JDBC Call


I will attach a diff that requires cleanup, refactoring and regression testing.;;Users;
column386: 29/Apr/24 2:24 PM;rene.mendez@oracle.com;Attachment:mlepagination.diff:Diff proposal, rename pctx to something meaningful, change magic numbers and extract strings to references.;;Users;

column1: INCREASE DEFAULT CACHE.METADATA.TIMEOUT VALUE TO 5 SECONDS
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Based on Srinivas's test runs we can reduce the executions of a particularly expensive metadata query by increasing the cache.metadata.timeout value

See sql_id d32szh6cubcw8 in the following AWR reports

default cache.metadata.timeout = 1s => 297 executions
https://perfwww.us.oracle.com/oltp/skareenh/jsonrel/REST/stat_lframestart_324/awr.html

cache.metadata.timeout = 5s => 60 executions
https://perfwww.us.oracle.com/oltp/skareenh/jsonrel/REST/stat_lframestart_326/awr.html


cache.metadata.timeout = 5m => 2 executions
https://perfwww.us.oracle.com/oltp/skareenh/jsonrel/REST/stat_lframestart_328/awr.html


i have asked Srinivas if he can use a cache.metadata.timeout value greater than 5m going forward ( e.g. 330s ) so that will be reflected in his reported test results.
however, increasing the default cache.metadata.timeout to 5s will clearly have a benefit for all and still not be too long for someone to wait for a change to take effect.

column389:
22/May/24 3:22 PM;carlos.quirarte@oracle.com;*STATUS* 

{*}Investigating the code I found out:{*}{*}{*}

The caches that are affected by this configuration setting change are:

 

CacheConfigurations

{ principals, privileges, resourceModules }

 

The default values for these 3 are:

cache.metadata.resourceModules -> 1s

cache.metadata.privileges -> 1s

cache.metadata.principals -> 30s

 

The test was done changing this 3 (by config overwrite), but not sure if I just should only change the ones with 1s as default.

 

[~peter.j.obrien@oracle.com] 

[~orla.behan@oracle.com] 

 ;;Users;
column390:
22/May/24 5:18 PM;carlos.quirarte@oracle.com;*STATUS*

Created a MR draft with change only on the configs that were affected by cache.metadata.timeout config setting, and the original default value was 1s. ;;Users;

column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:

curl -i --location --request PUT 'http://slc18uis.us.oracle.com:9193/ords/db1/stduser2938/_/db-api/stable/ords/properies/global.ui.footer_message.text.en' \

column1: DATA LOAD / CLOUD STORE - RELOAD DOES NOT PUT THE FOLDER BACK TO THE CART
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Bucket:
exec dbms_lineage_cloud.create_OR_REPLACE_CLOUD_STORAGE_LINK('AFSIE','https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/n/adwcdemo/b/Afsie-20210114-1449/o/');
exec dbms_lineage_cloud.SET_STORAGE_CREDENTIAL('AFSIE', 'AA_OCI_CRED');
Folder:   03" "
Directions:
1. From UI go to Data Load, Load Data, Cloud store.
2. From bucket Afsie select folder 03" ".
3. Go to the settings and add couple of Text Translation (danish, french), Close, Start to run a job, to create and populate the table.
3. After the load is finished select Reload

column1: CLOUD STORE - "ORA-40587: INVALID JSON TYPE"  REPORT AFTER REPLACE DATA ON TABLES WITH SPATIAL EXPRESSIONS
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Bucket:

Directions:
1. Using Admin, go to Data Load, Load data, Cloud Store.
2. Drag and drop geojson folder to the right pane and go to settings.
3. Add a Spaial expression and close, start to run the job to create and populate a table (I named the table GEO3).
4. From Sqlplus connect to admin and remove some records from the tableSQL> select count(*) from geo3;

  COUNT(*)
----------
        60

SQL> delete geo3 where rownum <=  40;

40 rows deleted.

SQL> select count(*) from geo3;

  COUNT(*)
----------
        20

SQL> commit;

5. From Data Load, Home, select Reload.
6. from setting select Replace Data. Close, Start, Run.
7. Select Report.

Job Report:
"ORA-40587: Invalid JSON type ORA-06512: at "SYS.JSON_OBJECT_T", Line 90 ORA-06512: at "C##ADP$SERVICE.DBMS_INGEST_ACTIONS"

column1: ERROR MESSAGE FOR REGISTER TO CLOUD LINK WHEN NOT GRANTED THE PRIVILEDGE NEEDS BETTER INFORMATION
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Log in as ADPTEST, on Data Load home page, pick a table, right click and
pick Register to Cloud Link.  If user does not have execute dbms_cloud_link_admin.grant_register('ADPTEST','MY$REGION');
The error message states:
Register to Cloud Link Error
ORA-20001: Schema Object undefined either does not exist or current user is not privileged to register the schema. ORA-06512: at "C##CLOUD$SERVICE.DBMS_CLOUD_LINK", line 364 ORA-06512: at line 2 https://docs.oracle.com/error-help/db/ora-20001/
Except the doc page does not exist via this link and ORA-20001 is you exceeded the max number of web services requests.
column345: {panel: bgColor=#96FAC8} Successfully updated corresponding bug.{panel}
column385: 10/Mar/24 9:05 PM;david.dedonato@oracle.com;We should trap this error and display a more helpful message.  Something like "The current user does not have the privilege to register this table as a Cloud link";;Users;
column386:
12/Mar/24 1:20 PM;david.bardwell@oracle.com;There is a real bug here. The SCHEMA_OBJECT is not getting set, and this is causing the error reported in this bug. Fix is to set the SCHEMA_NAME which comes in as a label. Will also include the additional help information about the current user not having privileges.

BEGIN
 C##CLOUD$SERVICE.DBMS_CLOUD_LINK.REGISTER(
    SCHEMA_NAME => 'ADPTEST',
    SCHEMA_OBJECT => 'undefined',
    NAMESPACE =>'ADPTEST',
    NAME=>'FOOCLOUDLINKNAME',
    description => 'test',
    scope=> 'MY$TENANCY');
END;;;Users;

column1: PL/SQL HANDLER ALTER SESSION  LEAKS INTO SUBSEQUENT CALLS
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
PL/SQL Handler ALTER Session can leak into subsequent calls if the default jdbc.cleanup.mode of RECYCLE is used.

If a handler alters the session then subsequent reuse of that connection will include those changes.

jdbc.cleanup.mode DISPOSE can be specified to always re proxy connections , ensuring the sesson state is clear.

REST-Enabled SQL protects against ALTER SESSION statements as it identifies when that statement is executed and ensures that the connections proxy is not reused.

But PL/SQL Handler does not have such a mechanism.

column388:
22/Jan/24 7:51 AM;dermot.oneill@oracle.com;Possibly just a check of the SQL text to see if "ALTER SESSION" is present. 
If it is, then remove the schema label to force a re proxy.;;Users;
column389:
22/Jan/24 7:53 AM;dermot.oneill@oracle.com;Fix:
Need a  ords-common  Connections.removeSchemaLabel(Connection conn)
Which canbe called to remove the schema label which will force subsequent requests when borrowing the connection to re-proxy to the target schema thereby clearing the state,

Then the PL/SQL Handler would need to just check if "ALTER SESSION" is present in the SQL and if it is call the above removeSchemaLabel method.;;Users;
column390: 22/Jan/24 8:14 AM;dermot.oneill@oracle.com;Alternatively when the connection is returned to the pool,  during the package state cleanup always run ALTER SESSION SET CURRENT_SCHEMA to the currently proxied schema to ensure they are in sync for future request.;;Users;

column1: JDBCITEMRESOURCEIMPL CAUSES A SQLEXCEPTION WHICH IS IGNORED
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
JDBCItemResourceImpl
- final String etag = rs.getString(JDBCResource.ETAG_KEY);

Can throw an java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column name

This Exception is caused but ignored.
There is a performance overhead when this SQLException is thrown.

column385:
21/May/24 6:01 PM;dermot.oneill@oracle.com;This can be reproduced by creating an autorest duality view and making a REST request to return a specific row using the ROWID.

Example:

create table Person (
   ID                                INTEGER not NULL,
   BIRTHDATE                         TIMESTAMP,
   CITY                              VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   COUNTRY                           VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   EMAIL                             VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   FIRSTNAME                         VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   JOINDATE                          TIMESTAMP,
   LASTLOGINDATE                     TIMESTAMP,
   LASTNAME                          VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   LOGINCOUNT                        NUMBER(10) NOT NULL,
   MIDDLENAME                        VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   PHONE                             VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   STATE                             VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   STREET                            VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   ZIP                               VARCHAR2(255 CHAR),
   constraint person_pk primary key(ID)
 );
 
create or replace json relational duality view person_dualv
AS
  select JSON {
    '_id'            is y.ID,
   'Birthdate'     is y.BIRTHDATE,
    'City'          is y.CITY,
    'Country'       is y.COUNTRY,
    'Email'         is y.EMAIL,
    'Firstname'     is y.FIRSTNAME,
   'Joindate'      is y.JOINDATE,
   'Lastlogindate' is y.LASTLOGINDATE,
   'Lastname'      is y.LASTNAME,
   'Logincount'    is y.LOGINCOUNT,
   'Middlename'    is y.MIDDLENAME,
   'Phone'         is y.PHONE,
   'State'         is y.STATE,
   'Street'        is y.STREET,
   'Zip'           is y.ZIP
   returning JSON
 }
from Person y with (INSERT,UPDATE,DELETE,CHECK ETAG);
 
INSERT INTO Person (ID,BIRTHDATE,CITY,COUNTRY,EMAIL,FIRSTNAME,JOINDATE,LASTLOGINDATE,LASTNAME,LOGINCOUNT,MIDDLENAME,PHONE,STATE,STREET,ZIP)
             VALUES(3,SYSTIMESTAMP, 'DUBLIN','IRELAND','barry.mcgillin@oracle.com','DERMOT',SYSTIMESTAMP,SYSTIMESTAMP,'ONEILL',1,null,'08724224242','IRL','Boroimhe Ash','EXDEDE');
 
INSERT INTO Person (ID,BIRTHDATE,CITY,COUNTRY,EMAIL,FIRSTNAME,JOINDATE,LASTLOGINDATE,LASTNAME,LOGINCOUNT,MIDDLENAME,PHONE,STATE,STREET,ZIP)

COMMIT;

column1: PERFORMANCE: USER_ORDS_OBJ_MEMBERS SHOULD JOIN MEMBER CONSTRAINT ON TABLE_NAME
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Subquery:

(SELECT ICC.OWNER OWNER,
ICC.TABLE_NAME TABLE_NAME,
ICC.COLUMN_NAME COLUMN_NAME,
ICC.POSITION PK_ORDER
FROM USER_CONSTRAINTS IUC,
USER_CONS_COLUMNS ICC
WHERE IUC.OWNER         = ICC.OWNER
AND IUC.CONSTRAINT_NAME = ICC.CONSTRAINT_NAME
AND CONSTRAINT_TYPE     = 'P'
) PKEY

should be changed to:

(SELECT ICC.OWNER OWNER,
ICC.TABLE_NAME TABLE_NAME,
ICC.COLUMN_NAME COLUMN_NAME,
ICC.POSITION PK_ORDER
FROM USER_CONSTRAINTS IUC,
USER_CONS_COLUMNS ICC
WHERE IUC.OWNER         = ICC.OWNER
AND IUC.CONSTRAINT_NAME = ICC.CONSTRAINT_NAME
AND CONSTRAINT_TYPE     = 'P'
) PKEY

to utilize index in optimizer

12/Feb/24 8:22 PM;joseph.pacheco@oracle.com;@Customer SR 3-35683993061: BUG: ORDS 23.4 ords_installer_privileges does not work for APEX



Problem description: ( should include the following )

-----------------------------------------------------

When attempting to install ORDS with a user other than SYS install fails,

The following error occurs when accessing ORDS.



ERROR

-----------------------

Not Found

HTTP Status Code: 404



Request ID: SRJ_8CwFg5oNC9xH3XZNeQ



Request Timestamp: 2024-02-12T23:11:11.167145178Z



Error Code: ORDS-22001



The procedure named apex could not be accessed, it may not be declared, or the user executing this request may not have been granted execute privilege on the procedure, or a function specified by security.requestValidationFunction configuration property has prevented access. Check the spelling of the procedure, check that the execute privilege has been granted to the caller and check the configured security.requestValidationFunction function. If using the PL/SQL Gateway Procedure Allow List, check that the procedure has been allowed via ords_admin.add_plsql_gateway_procedure.



This script works fine in ORDS 23.3 and below. If you install with SYS user all is fine as well. 



Steps to replicate: 

1. Use the ORDS 23.4 ords_installer_privileges script.

2. Install ORDS with the user specified in the ords_installer_privileges script

3. Attempt accessing ORDS.



Customer installing ORDS with non-SYS user.



4. Pertinent configuration information.

Standalone Install

5. On-Premise or Cloud?

On-Premise / Cloud



6.Testcase 

@Testcase location:

@-----------------

@Linux VNC: celvpvm06967.us.oracle.com:2

@

@oracle / welcome1



Testcase step-by-step instructions:

----------------------------------

1. Start with a database that doesn't have ORDS in it, but does have APEX.

sqlplus / as sysdba

@apexins sysaux sysaux temp /i/ <-- Install APEX 23.2

@catpatch <-- Patch APEX to 23.2.3 (Note I did not have to do this step. Stayed on Apex 22.2)

alter user apex_public_user identified by PassWord account unlock;

2. create user JPadmin identified by welcome1; 

   Grant connect, resource, dba to JPadmin;

As SYS run 

@/refresh/home/app/oracle/product/ords234/scripts/installer/ords_installer_privileges JPadmin



Set Environment and then install:

3. Install ORDS 23.4 with JPadmin in place of SYS

2. Try to get to the APEX home page, get the error.

3.Remove of ORDS from the database:

@/refresh/home/app/oracle/product/ords234/bin/ords --config /refresh/home/app/oracle/product/ords234/bin uninstall



4. Then do an install of ORDS using SYS per Note How To Install ORDS 22.x or Higher (Doc ID 2874117.1)

Set Environment and then install:



@/refresh/home/app/oracle/product/ords234/bin/ords install --interactive --log-folder ORDS_LOGS



Try to get to the APEX home page, No errors reported.





Generic/Port-specific findings:

----------------------------------

Did you test with the latest version? Yes






	  		Update

Platform        Product    Product Ver.    RDBMS Ver.   Reproduced (yes/no)

-----------     --------   ------------   -----------   ----------

Linux 8 64 Bit  Ords        23.4          19.2.0        Yes

Linux 8 64 Bit  Ords        23.3          19.2.0        No



Available workarounds:

---------------------

Install ORDS with SYS user.



Related bugs:

------------

Did you search for duplicate bugs? Yes None found.

NA





Additional information:  

-----------------------

This script works fine in ORDS 23.3 and below.  If you install with SYS user all is fine.

29/Mar/24 12:24 PM;elizabeth.saunders@oracle.com;Hi Joseph,

Can you please do the following?

1. Provide the installl log file.

2. Run the ords repair command

ords --config <path to config> install repair --interactive

3. Provide the repair log file

4. Execute this query:

 select owner, procedure_name from ords_metadata.plsql_gateway_allow_list where owner like 'APEX%';

Does it return any rows?
If no rows returned, then do the following:

4.a Execute the APEX procedure to populate the allow list. 
APEX_XXXX is the APEX schema:

BEGIN
    APEX_XXXX.wwv_flow_listener.sync_ords_gateway_allow_list;
END;
   
Check again if the allow list is populated:

select owner, procedure_name from ords_metadata.plsql_gateway_allow_list where owner like 'APEX%';

If any apex entries exist, then try accessing apex again.

03/May/24 11:06 AM;elizabeth.saunders@oracle.com;The ORDS allow_apex_entry_points.sql will detect if invoking APEX_XXXXXX.wwv_flow_listener.sync_ords_gateway_allow_list does not populate the pl/sql gateway allow list, then it will inovke ORDS fallback code to populate the allow list.  If an error occurs due to APEX schema installed in CDB$ROOT (common schema) and user is trying to install/upgrade or repair ORDS is a local non-sys user (not COMMON), display the warning message to the user on how to populate the allow list by using a COMMON user, and execute APEX_230200.wwv_flow_listener.sync_ords_gateway_allow_list.

column1: ORDS 24.X: CREATION / UPDATE OF A DB CONNECTION POOL WITH DIRECT GATEWAY MODE IS PROMPTING FOR ORDS_PUBLIC_USER CREDENTIALS
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
Issue with the auto installation feature introduced in ORDS 24.1 ->

Creation / update of a db pool with "direct" gateway mode is not working.
The following option always shows up as one of the multiple options with default values and there is no way to avoid it (you can choose to update this option if you want to change the password and specify your own password but there is not way to get rid of it):

[3] Database password for ORDS runtime user (ORDS_PUBLIC_USER): <generate>
Tested in-house and experience the same behavior.


Tested using the following commands but keep getting the prompt related to ORDS_PUBLIC_USER password.

For example:

ords --config <path_to_config> install --interactive --config-only --db-pool plsdbpool1 --gateway-user user1 --gateway-mode direct --log-folder <path_to_log_folder>

The following command, for example, works in ORDS 22.x and 23.4 but does not work in ORDS 24.1 or 24.1.1:

ords --config <path_to_config> install --interactive --db-pool plsdbpool1 --gateway-user user1 --gateway-mode direct --log-folder <path_to_log_folder>

In ORDS 24.x, get these prompts/options:

Enter a number to select the database connection type to use
    [1] Basic (host name, port, service name)
    [2] TNS (TNS alias, TNS directory)
    [3] Custom database URL
  Choose [1]:
  Enter the database host name [localhost]:
  Enter the database listen port [1521]:
  Enter the database service name [orcl]: xxxxx
  Enter the PL/SQL Gateway database password for plsqluser1:
Confirm password:
  Enter a number to update the value or select option A to Accept and Continue
    [1] Connection Type: Basic
    [2] Basic Connection: HOST=localhost PORT=1521 SERVICE_NAME=xxxxx
    [3] Database password for ORDS runtime user (ORDS_PUBLIC_USER): <generate>
    [4] Configure for Standalone Mode: Yes
    [5]    Protocol: HTTP
    [6]       HTTP Port: 8080
    [7]   APEX static resources location:
    [A] Accept and Continue - Create database pool
    [Q] Quit - Do not proceed. No changes
  Choose [A]:

If we choose option [3] to update the value:
Choose [A]: 3
  Enter your choice for the runtime user password (ORDS_PUBLIC_USER)
    [S] Specify your own password
    [G] Generate password
    [C] Cancel - No Changes
  
So getting prompted for an ORDS_PUBLIC_USER account credentials for a db pool with "direct" gateway mode.

In the previous ORDS versions, a db pool can be created with "proxied" gateway mode for plsql apps (non-Apex) OR "direct" gateway mode for plsql apps (non-Apex and no REST services).
  
In the new 24.x version, a db pool with "direct" gateway mode for plsql apps (non-Apex and no REST services) cannot be created. All db pools are created with "proxied" gateway mode.

column35:

Database Actions UI:

(admin/AutoS_Y_S123#)

vnc (pwd: oracle)
phoenix173458.dev3sub3phx.databasede3phx.oraclevcn.com:1

sqlplus:
sqlplus admin/AutoS_Y_S123#@phoenix173458.dev3sub3phx.databasede3phx.oraclevcn.com:1531/cdb1_pdb7.regress.rdbms.dev.us.oracle.com

ADP Schema Version - 25.5.999.0.3494,  ORDS - 24.2.0.b1101822, RDBMS_PT.DBCLOUD19_LINUX.X64_240402


Database Connections:

exec dbms_credential.drop_credential('phoenix94045_cbt_crd');
exec dbms_credential.create_credential('phoenix94045_cbt_crd', 'C##BTDB','C##BTDB');

drop database link phoenix94045_cdblnkbt;
create database link phoenix94045_cdblnkbt
connect with phoenix94045_cbt_crd
using 'phoenix94045.dev3sub2phx.databasede3phx.oraclevcn.com:1521/xtdb.regress.rdbms.dev.us.oracle.com';

select count(*) from user_tables@phoenix94045_cdblnkbt.regress.rdbms.dev.us.oracle.com;



Directions:
1. in UI as Admin go to Data Load, Database.
2. From C##BTDB select MSR1, DIM1, TR1 to right pane and Start to run a job to create tables from these sources.
3. Go to Analysis and select Create AV by clicking on + sign.
4. select MSR1 as fact table and create AV from generated hierarchies and measures.
5. From Analysis Delete this AV via 3 dots action menu on this object.
6. Go to catalog and search for Attribute dimension and hierarchies. Notice that these objects for the created AV were not removed.

column1: CREATE CLOUD STORAGE LINK IS NOT ALLOWED IF A READ ON FILE FAILS
column11: Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) Central JIRA Project
column35:
The problem was the we could list the files in the navigator but could not read a file, in this case we display the following error message "Cannot read file(s) from object store. Check URI location or permissions on object store."

To fix this issue we should do the following
1) Use the new Create Cloud Storage Link UI to show the navigator and let users for a file preview (New Jira for this ORDS-14800)
2) Default to the first file in the navigator for a preview
3) Show the Preview Error in the panel
4) Let users create the cloud storage link, even if they have errors in doing a preview
